snippet: The officials failed to alert residents amid a deluge of rain last summer that left more than 170 people dead, a judge found.
abstract: Court in southern Russia convicts four local officials of criminal negligence for failing to alert residents to flash flooding in Krymsk, which led to deaths of more than 170 people.
lead_paragraph: The officials failed to alert residents amid a deluge of rain last summer that left more than 170 people dead, a judge found.

headline.main: 4 Officials Convicted of Negligence Over Russia Flooding
